its ur blood sugar. if ur in a country that uses liters than it ideally between 3 and 7. but depends greatly on what you have eaten
Could be blood sugar or hemoglobin levels.
Blood sugar doesn't depend on height and weight. Normal is 70-100mg/dl. I think they can also check iron, but not sure what normal is off the top of my head.
I have had them do that to test iron levels

I had a finger prick for the first part of my sequential screening. But it was to fill up small circles on a peice of paper that they run tests on for abnormalities....down sydrom, spina bifida etc....
its a newer way i was told

title: Pricking your finger
